summary: A federal court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Amazon.com, Inc., commanding the company to appear and produce subscriber records, order history, billing/shipping information, and payment details from January 1, 1994, to January 1, 2005, for specified identifiers, as part of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for which the subpoena is issued to gather evidence.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the subpoena.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Amazon
events.description: Amazon.com, Inc. is commanded to appear before the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York to testify and produce records related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena demands Amazon produce subscriber records, order history, billing/shipping information, and payment details from January 1, 1994, to January 1, 2005, for specific identifiers.
The subpoena is part of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
Failure to comply with the subpoena constitutes contempt of court and subjects Amazon to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The subpoena was issued by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on September 27, 2021, with a scheduled appearance date of November 29, 2021.
